title: recent go-weekly and just the last revision fails to compile hg identify 52ba9506bd99 weekly/weekly.2012-02-07
body:
by **rounin.urashima**: 
recent go-weekly and just the last revision fails to compile hg identify 52ba9506bd99
weekly/weekly.2012-02-07

Before filing this bug, I checked whether it had been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull", "hg update default", rebuild.

I also saw:
issue #2934: 	go-weekly fails to complile 	
	1 person starred this issue and may be notified of changes. 

Which suggested that the GOROOT env was pointing in different directory

rounin@rounin$ cat -n ./update_exisiting_tree_to_latest_release 
     1	cd $GOROOT/src
     2	hg pull
     3	hg update release
     4	./all.bash

rounin@rounin$ ./update_exisiting_tree_to_latest_release 

[output truncated]
.
.
.
pidigits
threadring
chameneosredux

--- cd ../test
0 known bugs; 0 unexpected bugs

ALL TESTS PASSED

---
Installed Go for linux/amd64 in /home/rounin/go.
Installed commands in /home/rounin/go/bin.
The compiler is 6g.
rounin@rounin$ hg identify
c1702f36df03 (release-branch.r60) release/release.r60.3


rounin@rounin$ cat -n ./update_exisiting_tree_to_latest_weekly
     1	cd $GOROOT/src
     2	hg pull
     3	hg update weekly
     4	./all.bash

rounin@rounin$ ./update_exisiting_tree_to_latest_weekly

GOBIN=/home/rounin/go/bin
GOOS=linux
GOROOT=/home/rounin/go
rounin@rounin$ uname -a
Linux rounin 2.6.35-23-generic #41-Ubuntu SMP Wed Nov 24 11:55:36 UTC 2010 x86_64
GNU/Linux
